SEARCH
Package com.visionreport.api

Class Log

java.lang.Object
com.visionreport.api.Log
public final class Log extends Object
Represents a single log entry within a test case in the Vision Report.

Each Log corresponds to one step, checkpoint, or event recorded during a test's execution. Logs are created automatically through the Test.log(Status, String, String) and related methods.

  • Timestamp of the event
  • Status (e.g., PASS, FAIL, INFO, WARNING, SKIP)
  • Step name or short description
  • Detailed message (optional)
  • Attached media such as screenshots (optional)
  • Associated exceptions or errors (optional)
Example usage: 

 test.log(Status.PASS, "Verify Login", "User successfully logged in");
 test.log(Status.FAIL, "Load Dashboard", "Timeout while loading", MediaProvider.fromString("screenshot.png"));
 test.log(Status.FAIL, "Unexpected Error", new RuntimeException("Null pointer"));
Since:
1.0
Version:
1.3
Author:
Deepak

  • Method Details

    • getTimestamp

      public String getTimestamp()
      Returns the timestamp when this log was created.
      Returns:
      the timestamp string in hh:mm:ss a format NOTE: Useful for displaying when a specific step occurred within a test.

    • getStatus

      public Status getStatus()
      Returns the status associated with this log.
      Returns:
      the log status (never null) NOTE: Indicates the outcome level of the log (PASS, FAIL, INFO, etc.).

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the name or short title of this log entry.
      Returns:
      the log name, guaranteed non-empty NOTE: Useful for identifying the step or action performed.

    • getDetails

      public String getDetails()
      Returns detailed information or context associated with this log.
      Returns:
      the log details, guaranteed non-null NOTE: Can include messages, error explanations, or extra notes.

    • getMedia

      public MediaProvider getMedia()
      Returns any attached media associated with this log.
      Returns:
      the media object or null if none is attached NOTE: Can include screenshots, videos, or other visual evidence.

    • getThrowable

      public Throwable getThrowable()
      Returns any captured exception associated with this log.
      Returns:
      the throwable instance or null if none was recorded NOTE: Provides insight into failures or unexpected behavior during the test step.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a human-readable string representation of the log entry.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a concise summary of the log entry including timestamp, status, name, details, and media/throwable info NOTE: Useful for debugging, logging, or quick inspection of log content.
